1.description: Fourteen-year-old wizard having disturbing dreams about Voldemort. His scar hurts more than usual.

4.description: Excited about attending the Quidditch World Cup with the Weasleys. Escaping another miserable summer.

12.description: Shocked when the Goblet of Fire selects him as a fourth champion. Insists he didn't enter his name.

19.description: Successfully retrieves the golden egg from a Hungarian Horntail dragon using his broomstick.

26.description: Rescues Ron from the Black Lake using gillyweed. Stays behind to ensure all hostages are safe.

31.description: Navigates the dangerous maze in the third task alongside Cedric Diggory.

32.description: Transported to a graveyard via Portkey with Cedric. Witnesses Voldemort's return to physical form.

35.description: Returns from the graveyard with Cedric's body. Traumatized by the events he witnessed.

12.description: Jealous and hurt that Harry was selected as champion without telling him. Their friendship is strained.

18.description: Reconciles with Harry after seeing the danger of the first task. Realizes Harry didn't seek the glory.

23.description: Struggles to find a date for the Yule Ball. Eventually asks Hermione but she already has a date.

26.description: Serves as Harry's hostage in the second task. Unconscious at the bottom of the lake.
26.role: Hostage, What Harry would miss most

12.description: Believes Harry when he says he didn't enter his name in the Goblet. Supports him when Ron doesn't.

23.description: Stuns everyone at the Yule Ball by arriving as Viktor Krum's date, looking beautiful in elegant dress robes.

27.description: Argues with Ron about her relationship with Viktor Krum. Defends her right to attend the ball with whomever she chooses.

11.description: Welcomes students from Beauxbatons and Durmstrang. Announces the return of the Triwizard Tournament.

12.description: Troubled when Harry's name comes out of the Goblet. Accepts that Harry must compete despite his age.

35.description: Immediately believes Harry's account of Voldemort's return. Takes action to prepare for the coming war.

1.description: Appears in Harry's dream/vision planning something sinister with a servant. Stronger than before.

32.description: Returns to physical form using a dark ritual involving Harry's blood, his father's bone, and Wormtail's flesh.

33.description: Summons his Death Eaters and reveals he has regained his power. Punishes those who did not seek him.

34.description: Duels Harry in the graveyard. Their wands connect in Priori Incantatum, allowing Harry to escape.

11.description: Appears as the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher. Gruff, paranoid ex-Auror with a magical eye and wooden leg.

13.description: Teaches students about the Unforgivable Curses using live demonstrations. Particularly harsh on Neville.

35.description: Revealed to be Barty Crouch Jr. under Polyjuice Potion. Death Eater who helped engineer Harry's participation in tournament.

11.description: Handsome seventh-year Hufflepuff selected as Hogwarts champion. Popular and talented student.

19.description: Faces a Common Welsh Green dragon in the first task. Successfully retrieves his golden egg.

31.description: Teams up with Harry in the maze, showing good sportsmanship and loyalty to Hogwarts.

32.description: Murdered by Peter Pettigrew on Voldemort's orders after being transported to the graveyard.

6.description: Star Seeker for Bulgaria at the Quidditch World Cup. International celebrity despite his team's loss.

11.description: Arrives at Hogwarts as a student from Durmstrang Institute. Still surly and famous.

12.description: Selected as Durmstrang's champion for the Triwizard Tournament. Youngest champion until Harry is chosen.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball with Hermione Granger as his date. Shows a softer, more romantic side.

10.description: Stunning part-Veela student from Beauxbatons Academy. Has a magical aura that enchants nearby males.

12.description: Selected as Beauxbatons' champion for the Triwizard Tournament. Confident in her magical abilities.

19.description: Faces a Common Welsh Green dragon in the first task using charm work.

26.description: Fails to complete the second task, unable to rescue her hostage from the grotto.

5.description: Minister for Magic attending the Quidditch World Cup. Tries to maintain order during the Death Eater attack.

35.description: Refuses to believe Harry and Dumbledore's account of Voldemort's return. Prefers denial to facing the truth.

13.description: Still the unpleasant Potions Master. Shows particular contempt for Mad-Eye Moody's teaching methods.

35.description: Sent on a secret mission by Dumbledore after Voldemort's return. His role remains mysterious.

1.description: Harry's godfather, still in hiding but maintaining contact through letters. Concerned about Harry's wellbeing.

19.description: Secretly returns to support Harry during the tournament, living in caves near Hogsmeade.

27.description: Communicates with Harry through the fireplace at Grimmauld Place, offering advice and support.

13.description: Teaching Care of Magical Creatures with his usual enthusiasm for dangerous animals. Shows the class Blast-Ended Skrewts.

19.description: Shows Harry the dragons before the first task, indirectly helping him prepare.

28.description: Reveals he is half-giant, which causes some students and parents to demand his dismissal.

1.description: Voldemort's servant, helping him plan his return. Still in his human form after escaping in the previous year.

32.description: Performs the ritual to restore Voldemort's body, sacrificing his own hand in the process.

33.description: Rewarded with a new silver hand by Voldemort for his faithful service.

10.description: Headmaster of Durmstrang Institute. Thin man with a goatee who brings his students to Hogwarts.

27.description: Revealed to be a former Death Eater who turned informant to avoid Azkaban. Nervous about Voldemort's return.

36.description: Flees Hogwarts in fear after Voldemort's return, knowing his former master will seek revenge.

10.description: Elegant headmistress of Beauxbatons Academy. Extremely tall and imposing woman.

19.description: Accompanies Hagrid to see the dragons, showing romantic interest in him.

28.description: Revealed to be half-giant like Hagrid, though she initially denies it.

18.description: Unscrupulous Daily Prophet reporter who writes sensational articles about the tournament and Harry.

24.description: Publishes damaging articles about Harry's supposed romance troubles and mental instability.

28.description: Exposes Hagrid as a half-giant, causing public outcry and calls for his dismissal.

7.description: Senior Ministry official who oversees international magical cooperation. Organizing the tournament.

28.description: Behaving strangely and appears ill. Shows signs of being under magical control.

29.description: Escapes the Imperius Curse temporarily and tries to warn Dumbledore about his son before being killed.

5.description: Head of the Department of Magical Games and Sports. Enthusiastic and jovial former Quidditch player.

8.description: Takes bets on the World Cup match and seems overly friendly with Fred and George Weasley.

37.description: Revealed to be deeply in debt to goblins and has been trying to pay them with leprechaun gold.

21.description: Works in the Hogwarts kitchens as a free elf. Still devoted to Harry and eager to help him.

26.description: Provides Harry with gillyweed for the second task, helping him breathe underwater.

8.description: House-elf belonging to Barty Crouch Sr. Found with Harry's wand after the Dark Mark incident.

9.description: Dismissed by Barty Crouch for the wand incident. Devastated by her dismissal from service.

21.description: Works in Hogwarts kitchens but is depressed and drinking heavily. Misses her old family.

3.description: Ron's father who works at the Ministry. Uses Floo Powder to collect Harry from Privet Drive.

5.description: Excited about the World Cup, has obtained tickets through his Ministry connections.

8.description: Helps investigate the Dark Mark incident and escorts his family to safety.

3.description: Ron's caring mother who welcomes Harry warmly to the Burrow.

5.description: Worries about her family's safety at the World Cup but enjoys the festivities.
One of the Weasley twins, excited about the World Cup and planning business ventures.

8.description: Made a bet with Ludo Bagman on the World Cup outcome but hasn't been paid.

16.description: Supports Harry and believes he didn't enter the tournament himself.

5.description: Fred's twin brother, equally entrepreneurial and mischievous.

8.description: Along with Fred, angry about not being paid by Bagman for their winning bet.

16.description: Like Fred, believes Harry and supports him during the tournament controversy.

3.description: Ron's younger sister, now in her third year at Hogwarts.

5.description: Enjoys the World Cup festivities with her family.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball with Neville Longbottom as her date.

5.description: Eldest Weasley son working as a curse-breaker for Gringotts. Cool and collected.

8.description: Helps search for clues after the Dark Mark incident at the World Cup.

5.description: Second eldest Weasley son who works with dragons in Romania.

19.description: Brought dragons from Romania for the first tournament task.

5.description: Recent Hogwarts graduate now working at the Ministry in Barty Crouch's department.

7.description: Busy with Ministry work helping organize the World Cup and tournament.

11.description: Pretty Ravenclaw Seeker in her sixth year. Harry has a crush on her.

22.description: Harry wants to ask her to the Yule Ball but feels too nervous.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball with Cedric Diggory, looking beautiful in her dress robes.

10.description: Fellow Gryffindor in Harry's year. Still clumsy but trying his best.

13.description: Terrified by Mad-Eye Moody's demonstration of the Cruciatus Curse in Defense class.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball with Ginny Weasley as his date.

10.description: Gryffindor student in Harry's year and dormitory.

14.description: Initially skeptical about Harry's tournament entry but later supportive.

10.description: Irish Gryffindor student in Harry's year, excited about Ireland's World Cup victory.

14.description: Like most students, initially doubts Harry's story about not entering the tournament.

11.description: Ravenclaw student, twin sister of Parvati Patil in Gryffindor.

23.description: Ron's reluctant date to the Yule Ball. Not particularly impressed with his behavior.

11.description: Gryffindor student in Harry's year, twin sister of Padma in Ravenclaw.

23.description: Harry's date to the Yule Ball. Disappointed by his lack of attention during the evening.

11.description: Gryffindor student in Harry's year, close friend of Parvati Patil.

22.description: Excited about the Yule Ball and helps her friends prepare for it.

11.description: Slytherin student in Harry's year. Still antagonistic toward Harry and his friends.

14.description: Creates 'Potter Stinks' badges to mock Harry's tournament participation.

18.description: Enjoys the negative publicity Harry receives from Rita Skeeter's articles.

35.description: Present when Harry returns with Cedric's body but doesn't understand the significance.

11.description: Draco Malfoy's dim-witted Slytherin follower and bodyguard.

14.description: Helps distribute the 'Potter Stinks' badges made by Malfoy.

11.description: Draco Malfoy's other dim-witted Slytherin follower and bodyguard.

14.description: Joins in the mockery of Harry with the 'Potter Stinks' badges.

6.description: Draco's father, attending the World Cup in the Minister's box as a wealthy wizard.

7.description: Present during the Death Eater attack at the World Cup but claims innocence.

33.description: Revealed as a Death Eater who answers Voldemort's summons in the graveyard.

10.description: Deputy Headmistress and Transfiguration professor. Head of Gryffindor House.

12.description: Concerned when Harry's name comes out of the Goblet but must enforce tournament rules.

23.description: Helps organize the Yule Ball and teaches students ballroom dancing.

35.description: Shocked by Harry's account of Voldemort's return and Cedric's death.

10.description: Herbology professor and Head of Hufflepuff House.

21.description: Tends the gillyweed and other magical plants used in the tournament tasks.

10.description: Charms professor and Head of Ravenclaw House. Small in stature but skilled in magic.

23.description: Helps decorate the Great Hall for the Yule Ball with magical decorations.

19.description: Hogwarts matron who treats injuries from the dangerous tournament tasks.

26.description: Cares for the rescued hostages from the Black Lake task.

35.description: Tends to Harry after his traumatic experience in the graveyard.

10.description: Fleur's younger sister, part-Veela like her sister but still a child.

26.description: Serves as Fleur's hostage in the second task, rescued from the lake by Harry.
26.role: Hostage, What Fleur would miss most

5.description: Cedric's father, works for the Ministry in the Department for Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures.

7.description: Very proud of Cedric's achievements and tends to boast about his son.

35.description: Devastated by Cedric's death and struggles to understand what happened.

8.description: Chaser on the Irish National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Chaser on the Irish National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Chaser on the Irish National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Keeper on the Irish National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Beater on the Irish National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Beater on the Irish National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Seeker on the Irish National Quidditch team at the World Cup, outplayed by Viktor Krum.
Chaser on the Bulgarian National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Chaser on the Bulgarian National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Keeper on the Bulgarian National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
Chairman of the International Association of Quidditch and referee of the World Cup final.

33.description: Death Eater and Ministry executioner who answers Voldemort's summons in the graveyard.
Death Eater who appears in the graveyard when Voldemort summons his followers.
Death Eater who responds to Voldemort's call in the graveyard. Father of Theodore Nott.
Death Eater and father of Vincent Crabbe, appears in the graveyard.
Death Eater and father of Gregory Goyle, answers Voldemort's summons.

30.description: Former Ministry employee mentioned as being imprisoned in Azkaban for Death Eater activities.

33.description: Death Eater who escaped Azkaban and appears in the graveyard to serve Voldemort.
Death Eater who appears in the graveyard when summoned by the Dark Mark.

10.description: Seventh-year Gryffindor and Chaser on the Quidditch team. Popular and athletic.

12.description: Tries to enter her name in the Goblet of Fire but is rejected due to the age restriction.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball with Fred Weasley as her date.

10.description: Gryffindor student and friend of the Weasley twins. Known for his Quidditch commentary.

19.description: Provides commentary for the first tournament task, describing the dragon challenges.

26.description: Commentates on the second task from the lake shore, though visibility is limited.

11.description: Slytherin student in Harry's year, close friend and admirer of Draco Malfoy.

14.description: Eagerly supports Draco's campaign to mock Harry with the 'Potter Stinks' badges.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball as Draco Malfoy's date.

11.description: Ravenclaw Quidditch captain and seventh-year student.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball with Fleur Delacour as his date, completely mesmerized by her Veela charm.

11.description: Hufflepuff student known for being pompous but loyal to his house.

14.description: Initially supports Cedric over Harry but is fair-minded about the tournament.

11.description: Gryffindor student who idolizes Harry, always taking photographs with his camera.

14.description: Excited that Harry is a champion and wants to photograph everything about the tournament.

25.description: Ghost who haunts a girls' bathroom at Hogwarts. Helps Harry understand the golden egg clue.

26.description: Provides information about the Black Lake and its merpeople for the second task.

7.description: Elderly wizard at the World Cup who refuses to wear Muggle clothing, insisting on wearing a flowery nightgown.
Ministry wizard trying to get elderly wizards to dress like Muggles for the World Cup.

relationships.Archie: Trying to make wear Muggle clothes

7.description: Ministry wizard working at the World Cup dealing with various magical incidents.
Ministry wizard working security and crowd control at the Quidditch World Cup.

8.description: Bulgarian Minister for Magic attending the World Cup final in the Top Box.

7.description: Muggle campsite manager who keeps having his memory modified by Ministry officials due to magical incidents.

9.description: Had his memory wiped again after witnessing the Dark Mark and Death Eater attack.

8.description: Magical creatures serving as mascots for the Irish National Quidditch team, creating golden coins.
Magical beings serving as mascots for Bulgaria, beautiful women who can entrance men with their dance.

2.description: Harry's uncle who continues to treat him poorly. Barely acknowledges Harry's existence at Privet Drive.

3.description: Panicked when the Weasleys arrive via Floo Powder, ending up with his living room destroyed.

2.description: Harry's aunt who ignores him throughout his stay. Shows no interest in his wellbeing.

3.description: Terrified by the magical chaos when the Weasleys arrive to collect Harry.

2.description: Harry's spoiled cousin who continues to bully him when possible but mostly avoids him.

3.description: Victim of Fred and George's Ton-Tongue Toffee, which makes his tongue swell enormously.

1.description: Elderly gardener at the Riddle House who overhears Voldemort planning. Murdered for witnessing too much.
Large snake and companion of Voldemort. Discovers Frank Bryce eavesdropping on Voldemort's plans.

32.description: Present during Voldemort's resurrection ritual in the graveyard. Part of Voldemort's inner circle.

1.description: Wealthy Muggle murdered decades ago along with his family. The villagers still gossip about the mysterious deaths.

32.description: Used in Voldemort's resurrection ritual - bone of the father taken from his grave.

35.description: The real Alastor Moody, found imprisoned in his own magical trunk. Legendary Auror who was impersonated all year.

36.description: Recovering from his imprisonment. Confirms Harry's story about the events in the graveyard.

11.description: Hogwarts caretaker who maintains the castle and enforces rules with his usual grumpiness.

23.description: Helps prepare the Great Hall for the Yule Ball, decorating and arranging furniture.

11.description: Filch's cat who patrols the castle and reports rule-breaking students to her master.

25.description: Nearly catches Harry sneaking around the castle at night with the golden egg.

11.description: Colin Creevey's younger brother, just starting his first year at Hogwarts. Fell into the Black Lake.

12.description: Sorted into Gryffindor House like his brother. Excited about everything magical.

11.description: Gryffindor Chaser on the Quidditch team, one year above Harry.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball with a Ravenclaw student as her date.

11.description: Gryffindor Chaser on the Quidditch team, friend of Katie Bell and Angelina Johnson.

23.description: Attends the Yule Ball with Lee Jordan as her date.

18.description: Famous wandmaker who examines the champions' wands before the tournament tasks begin.

19.description: Four dangerous dragons brought from different countries for the first tournament task. Each guards a golden egg.

relationships.Champions: Face off against in first task

20.description: Successfully contained and returned to their reserves after the first task is completed.

25.description: Aquatic magical beings living in the depths of the Black Lake, guardians of the lake's secrets.

26.description: Cooperate with tournament officials to guard the hostages during the second task underwater.

34.description: Harry's father who appears as a spirit echo when Harry's wand connects with Voldemort's in Priori Incantatum.
Harry's mother who appears as a spirit echo during the wand connection, encouraging Harry to escape.

1.description: Ministry witch who has gone missing while on vacation in Albania. Mentioned in Voldemort's plans.

30.description: Revealed to have been captured and tortured by Voldemort for information about the Ministry and Hogwarts.

33.description: Confirmed dead, killed by Voldemort after providing information about Barty Crouch Jr. and the tournament.

2.description: Harry's loyal snowy owl who delivers his letters to Sirius and brings him correspondence.

3.description: Travels with Harry to the Burrow, adapting to the new environment with the other Weasley owls.

11.description: Hufflepuff student in Harry's year, quiet but loyal to her house and friends.
Hufflepuff student in Harry's year, known for being well-spoken and coming from a wealthy Muggle family.
Hufflepuff student in Harry's year, has family connections to the Ministry through her aunt.
Hufflepuff student known for being skeptical and somewhat unpleasant in his questioning.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year, intelligent and studious like most of his house.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year, part of the close-knit group of Ravenclaw fourth-years.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year, friends with the other Ravenclaw boys in his year.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year, one of the girls in Ravenclaw fourth year.
Ravenclaw student in Harry's year, studies alongside the other Ravenclaw girls.
Slytherin student in Harry's year, part of Draco Malfoy's social circle but more reserved.
Slytherin student in Harry's year, son of a Death Eater though this isn't widely known at school.
Large Slytherin girl in Harry's year, one of Pansy Parkinson's friends.
Former Slytherin Quidditch Captain, now in his eighth year. Still at Hogwarts despite being older.
Slytherin student and Quidditch player, part of the house team.
Slytherin student and Beater on the Quidditch team.

30.description: Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement, mentioned as a powerful and fair Ministry official.

36.description: Senior Auror who arrives at Hogwarts after Voldemort's return is reported.

30.description: Ministry official mentioned in discussions about departmental restructuring.
Death Eater imprisoned in Azkaban for torturing the Longbottoms. Fanatically loyal to Voldemort.
Death Eater and Bellatrix's husband, also imprisoned for torturing the Longbottoms.
Death Eater and brother of Rodolphus, imprisoned with the others for the Longbottom torture.

33.description: Dead Death Eater mentioned by Voldemort as someone who died rather than renounce the Dark Arts.
Dead Death Eater mentioned by Voldemort as another who died rather than abandon their cause.

11.description: Portrait that guards the entrance to Gryffindor Tower, requiring the password to allow entry.
Eccentric knight portrait who sometimes fills in for the Fat Lady, known for his enthusiasm and poor combat skills.
Gryffindor House ghost who welcomes students back and gossips about castle happenings.
Slytherin House ghost, covered in silver bloodstains and feared by most students.
Ravenclaw House ghost, ethereal and distant, rarely interacting with students.
Hufflepuff House ghost, jovial and kind, always ready to help students with a cheerful attitude.

15.description: Hogwarts librarian who guards the library books jealously and maintains strict silence.

13.description: Ghost professor who teaches History of Magic in the most boring way possible. Students often fall asleep.
Flying instructor and Quidditch referee at Hogwarts. Maintains school broomsticks and equipment.
Divination professor who teaches fortune-telling and prophecy in her tower classroom filled with crystal balls.
Astronomy professor who teaches students about stars, planets, and celestial movements from the tower.
Arithmancy professor who teaches the magical properties of numbers to advanced students.

31.description: Mythical creature with a woman's head and eagle's wings that guards a path in the tournament maze with riddles.

26.description: Aggressive water demons with long fingers that attack Harry during the second task in the Black Lake.

13.description: Dangerous hybrid creatures bred by Hagrid, resembling shell-less lobsters with explosive tendencies.

33.description: Death Eater who appears in the graveyard when Voldemort summons his followers.
Death Eater present at Voldemort's resurrection in the graveyard.
Death Eater who responds to Voldemort's call in the graveyard gathering.

23.description: Durmstrang student who appears to have a crush on a Hogwarts student at the Yule Ball.

10.description: Group of elegant students from Beauxbatons Academy who arrive in a magnificent flying carriage.
Students from Durmstrang Institute who arrive on a ghostly ship that rises from the Black Lake.

3.description: Elderly, somewhat unreliable Weasley family owl who often crashes into windows and gets lost.
Ron's tiny, overexcited owl given to him by Sirius as a replacement for Scabbers.

13.description: Former Auror and Neville's father, tortured into insanity by Death Eaters using the Cruciatus Curse.
Former Auror and Neville's mother, tortured alongside her husband by Death Eaters into permanent insanity.

11.description: Slytherin Chaser and member of the Quidditch team.
Slytherin Chaser and member of the house Quidditch team.

2.description: Ministry employee who sends official warnings to underage wizards for magic use violations.

8.description: Ministry employee who assists Ludo Bagman with Quidditch World Cup organization and betting.

12.description: Magical hat that sorts new students into Hogwarts houses. Places Dennis Creevey and other first-years.

31.description: The Triwizard Cup placed at the center of the maze as the tournament's final goal.

32.description: Revealed to be a Portkey that transports Harry and Cedric to the graveyard where Voldemort waits.

8.description: Irish Minister for Magic celebrating his country's World Cup victory in the Top Box.
Third Chaser on the Bulgarian National Quidditch team at the World Cup.
One of the two Beaters on the Bulgarian National Quidditch team.
The second Beater on Bulgaria's national team, working with Vulchanov.

11.description: Hogwarts student in one of the houses, attending the welcome feast.
First-year student who arrives at Hogwarts and is sorted into one of the houses.
First-year student arriving at Hogwarts for her first term.
First-year student joining Hogwarts and participating in the Sorting ceremony.
First-year student who joins Hogwarts and is sorted into her house.
First-year student starting at Hogwarts.
First-year student arriving for his first year at Hogwarts.
First-year student joining Hogwarts for the first time.

36.description: Auror who works for the Ministry and is mentioned in connection with security matters.
Senior Auror mentioned in Ministry discussions about security and Voldemort's return.

30.description: Ministry employee mentioned in departmental discussions.

8.description: Brazilian Minister for Magic attending the World Cup as an international dignitary.
Ugandan Minister for Magic present at the World Cup as part of the international delegation.

18.description: Daily Prophet photographer who takes pictures of the tournament champions and creates magical moving photographs.

24.description: Reporter from Witch Weekly magazine covering the social aspects of the tournament.

33.description: Death Eater present at the graveyard gathering when Voldemort returns.
Death Eater who answers Voldemort's summons in the graveyard.

15.description: Famous wizard mentioned in Transfiguration studies, known for his work on switching spells.

20.description: Ancient wizard who created the magical Gubraithian fire that never goes out.

13.description: Historical Chief of the Wizengamot mentioned in History of Magic lessons.

21.description: Skeletal winged horses that can only be seen by those who have witnessed death, living in the Forbidden Forest.

15.description: Intelligent half-human, half-horse creatures living deep in the Forbidden Forest, skilled in astronomy and divination.
Giant spiders living in the Forbidden Forest, descendants of Aragog's colony.

27.description: Ancient house-elf serving the Black family at Grimmauld Place, mentioned in Sirius's letters.

19.description: Specialized healer present at tournament tasks to treat injuries from dangerous challenges.
Security wizard responsible for maintaining order and safety during the dangerous tournament tasks.

7.description: Wizard selling World Cup merchandise and magical souvenirs at the campsite.

8.description: Vendor selling magical omnioculars that enhance the viewing experience at the Quidditch match.

16.description: Ravenclaw student who attempts to enter the tournament by crossing the age line.
Hufflepuff student who also tries to cross the age line to enter the tournament.

relationships.Fawcett: Partners with in age line attempt

8.description: German Minister for Magic attending the World Cup as part of the international delegation.
Group of Egyptian wizards attending the World Cup as international representatives.

14.description: Magical screaming letter that Mrs. Weasley sends to Ron after he's seen in Rita Skeeter's article.

16.description: Magical barrier created by Dumbledore around the Goblet of Fire to prevent underage students from entering.

32.description: Gravestone of Tom Riddle Sr. in Little Hangleton graveyard, used in Voldemort's resurrection ritual.
Large stone cauldron used in the dark ritual to restore Voldemort to physical form.

27.description: Witches who read Witch Weekly magazine and send Hermione hate mail after Rita Skeeter's articles.

30.description: Medical wizards working at St. Mungo's Hospital caring for the Longbottoms and other long-term patients.

19.description: Golden egg retrieved from dragons in the first task, containing a clue for the second task.

25.description: Contains merperson song that reveals the second task involves rescuing something precious from the Black Lake.

relationships.Black Lake: Points to location of second task

26.description: Magical plant that allows the user to breathe underwater and grow gills, provided to Harry by Dobby.

12.description: First-year student sorted into one of the houses during the welcome feast.
First-year student participating in the Sorting ceremony.
First-year student joining Hogwarts and being sorted into her house.

11.description: Younger Gryffindor student who admires Harry Potter.
Younger Gryffindor student attending the feast.
Younger student at Hogwarts, enthusiastic about Quidditch.
Slytherin student in Harry's year, quiet but observant.
Slytherin student in Harry's year, comes from a pure-blood family.

30.description: Ministry employee working in Magical Maintenance, mentioned in departmental discussions.
Muggle-born witch married to Reg Cattermole, mentioned in Ministry records.

8.description: Wizard responsible for managing the team mascots during the World Cup match.
Wizard responsible for maintaining the Quidditch pitch for the World Cup final.

19.description: Professional dragon handler working with Charlie Weasley to manage the tournament dragons.
Veterinary wizard specializing in dragon care, present to treat any injuries during the first task.

8.description: Japanese Minister for Magic attending the World Cup as part of the international delegation.
Canadian Minister for Magic present at the World Cup final.
French Minister for Magic attending the World Cup final as an international dignitary.

7.description: Security wizard working crowd control at the World Cup campsite.
Another security wizard managing safety at the World Cup event.

33.description: One of the Dementors guarding Azkaban prison, mentioned as potential recruits for Voldemort.
Another Dementor from Azkaban that Voldemort considers recruiting to his cause.

19.description: The most dangerous dragon breed, faced by Harry in the first tournament task.
Dragon breed with distinctive red coloring, faced by Viktor Krum in the tournament.
Relatively docile dragon breed, but still dangerous in tournament conditions.
Silver-blue dragon with powerful flames, one of the four tournament dragons.

33.description: Death Eater present at Voldemort's return in the graveyard.
Death Eater who answers Voldemort's summons in the graveyard.

4.description: Shop owner in Diagon Alley selling magical supplies and equipment.
Owner of the Magical Menagerie pet shop in Diagon Alley.

11.description: The painted horse that Sir Cadogan rides in his portrait adventures.
Portrait of a lady hanging in one of Hogwarts' corridors.

17.description: One of the four founders of Hogwarts, mentioned in History of Magic lessons.
One of Hogwarts' four founders, known for her fairness and acceptance of all students.
Hogwarts founder known for her wit and wisdom, creator of Ravenclaw House.
Controversial Hogwarts founder who valued pure-blood heritage and cunning.

18.description: Magical quill used by Rita Skeeter that writes sensationalized versions of interviews.

14.description: Owl responsible for delivering Daily Prophet newspapers to Hogwarts students.

9.description: Ministry wizard responsible for modifying Muggle memories after magical incidents.

18.description: Ministry wizard who teaches Apparition to students, mentioned in career discussions.

14.description: Sturdy owl capable of delivering volatile Howler letters without being affected by their magic.

20.description: Magical hospital bed that adjusts automatically to provide comfort and aid healing.

11.description: Magically enchanted ceiling that reflects the sky outside, creating atmosphere for feasts.

31.description: Shape-shifting creature placed in the tournament maze that takes the form of a person's worst fear.
Dark creatures used as obstacles in the tournament maze, though they may be Boggarts taking Dementor form.

37.description: Petty criminal and occasional Order member mentioned in passing conversations about shady characters.

26.description: Massive friendly squid living in the Black Lake, harmless to students.

10.description: Magnificent winged horses the size of elephants that pull Beauxbatons' flying carriage. Drink only single-malt whiskey.
Magical ship that emerges from the depths of the Black Lake to transport Durmstrang students to Hogwarts.

4.description: Hermione's Muggle parents who are both dentists. Mentioned as being concerned about her summer activities.

30.description: Senior Undersecretary to the Minister, mentioned as having significant influence in the Ministry.

33.description: Savage werewolf allied with Voldemort, mentioned among those expected to answer the summons.

20.description: Mentioned as dangerous magical beings that both sides might try to recruit in a coming war.

33.description: Dark creatures that guard Azkaban prison, mentioned as potential allies Voldemort might recruit.

recaps.1: At the Riddle House, villagers whisper about the mysterious deaths of the Riddle family. An old gardener overhears a strange meeting inside the house involving Voldemort and his servant.
recaps.2: Harry wakes from a disturbing dream about Voldemort and writes to Sirius Black for advice. The Dursleys largely ignore Harry as he prepares for the rest of the summer.
recaps.3: The Weasleys arrive via Floo Powder to collect Harry, accidentally wrecking the Dursleys' living room. Harry happily leaves Privet Drive with them.
recaps.4: Harry enjoys his stay at the Burrow while the Weasleys prepare for the Quidditch World Cup. He hears more rumors about rising dark magic activity.
recaps.5: Harry, Hermione, and the Weasleys travel by Portkey to the Quidditch World Cup. They arrive at the enormous, bustling campsite full of magical tents and wizards from around the world.
recaps.6: They watch the exciting Quidditch World Cup match between Ireland and Bulgaria. Viktor Krum impresses the crowd despite his team's loss.
recaps.7: That night, chaos erupts as masked wizards attack the campsite. A mysterious symbol, the Dark Mark, appears in the sky, frightening everyone.
recaps.8: The Ministry investigates the attack and interrogates Winky the house-elf. Harry notices his wand is missing and later found at the scene of the Dark Mark.
recaps.9: Back at the Burrow, tension lingers about the World Cup incident. Letters arrive from Hogwarts with unexpected news about the coming school year.
recaps.10: On the way to Hogwarts, Harry, Ron, and Hermione overhear talk about the Triwizard Tournament. They learn visiting schools will compete for glory.
recaps.11: Students from Beauxbatons and Durmstrang arrive at Hogwarts in grand magical fashion. Their headmasters, Madame Maxime and Igor Karkaroff, make strong impressions.
recaps.12: Dumbledore announces the Triwizard Tournament and introduces the Goblet of Fire. He explains the age limit and rules for entering.
recaps.13: The Halloween feast ends with students submitting names into the Goblet. Everyone speculates who will be chosen as champion.
recaps.14: The Goblet selects Viktor Krum, Fleur Delacour, and Cedric Diggory as champions—then unexpectedly produces a fourth name: Harry Potter.
recaps.15: Shock spreads as Harry is forced into the tournament. He insists he never entered his name, but most students doubt him.
recaps.16: Harry struggles under the unwanted attention and skepticism from classmates. Only Ron and Hermione debate how he was entered.
recaps.17: Harry learns more about the tournament tasks from Hagrid. He begins to understand the danger involved.
recaps.18: Rita Skeeter interviews Harry for the Daily Prophet, twisting his words. Harry feels the pressure of unwanted fame again.
recaps.19: Harry discovers the first task involves dragons. Hagrid secretly shows him the dangerous creatures in the forest.
recaps.20: Harry warns Cedric about the dragons as a show of good sportsmanship. He searches for a spell to help him survive the task.
recaps.21: Harry faces the dragon, summoning his broom with Accio. He successfully retrieves the golden egg and earns applause.
recaps.22: After the task, Harry gains new respect from classmates. The golden egg's screeching clue puzzles him.
recaps.23: Ron apologizes for doubting Harry and their friendship is restored. Hermione pushes them to solve the egg's riddle.
recaps.24: The Yule Ball is announced, and students scramble for dates. Harry nervously asks Cho, but she already has a partner.
recaps.25: The Yule Ball takes place with music and dancing. Harry and Ron have awkward dates but observe intriguing interactions among the adults.
recaps.26: Harry learns about past Death Eaters during a conversation with Karkaroff and Snape. Suspicion grows around several professors.
recaps.27: Harry works to solve the egg clue, but progress is slow. Moaning Myrtle offers unexpected help.
recaps.28: Harry cracks the egg clue and learns he must recover something valuable from the Black Lake. He prepares for the second task.
recaps.29: Harry completes the second task using gillyweed from Dobby. He rescues Ron and earns high marks for moral judgment.
recaps.30: Tension rises as the third task nears and strange happenings plague Hogwarts. Rita Skeeter causes more trouble with her gossip.
recaps.31: The champions enter the maze for the third task. Harry and Cedric face dangerous creatures and enchanted obstacles.
recaps.32: Harry and Cedric seize the Triwizard Cup together, but it transports them elsewhere. They realize too late it is a Portkey.
recaps.33: Harry witnesses a terrifying ritual that restores Voldemort to physical form. Voldemort calls his followers, the Death Eaters.
recaps.34: Voldemort duels Harry in a graveyard. Their wands connect in a strange magical clash that allows Harry to escape with Cedric's body.
recaps.35: Harry returns to Hogwarts carrying Cedric's body. Panic and grief spread through the crowd.
recaps.36: Dumbledore comforts Harry and listens to his story. The Ministry begins to deny Voldemort's return.
recaps.37: The school year ends in uncertainty. Harry prepares to return to Privet Drive with Voldemort's return weighing heavily.
